snippet: Under a tight deadline, the Obama administration awarded the company, Serco, a contract worth as much as $1.2 billion to help sift applications for insurance and tax credits under the new law.
abstract: Obama administration, racing to meet October deadline, awards British company Serco a contract worth as much as $1.2 billion to help sift through applications for health insurance and tax credits under the new health care law.
lead_paragraph: Under a tight deadline, the Obama administration awarded the company, Serco, a contract worth as much as $1.2 billion to help sift applications for insurance and tax credits under the new law.

headline.main: British Company Is Awarded Contract to Administer Health Rollout
headline.print_headline: Big Contract Is Awarded To Administer Health Rollout

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
